title: Wine label design
content:
Hi everyone,

I am currently trying to finish a wine label but the client insists on this script font Vivante DTC which I frankly don't like at all. I need your advice. Could You please suggest a nice script font or a serif font with nice italics which goes well with the illustration? Thank you very much for your suggestions.

\* This is a screenshot with the front and the back label

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090852im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-03-25%20at%2020_5329.41.35.png)
author: Marina Jukić

comments.content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417090852im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bernhard_6444.jpg)
  
Bernhard Modern Bold Italic retains some of the angularity of the current font and works with the Roman type below it and on the back label.
